title: G-20 Backs Tax Overhaul That Makes Rich Countries Big Winners
sub_head: Deal aims to give governments more tax revenues by reducing avoidance, but poor countries gain little
body:
Leaders of the worldâ€™s biggest economies endorsed a deal on corporate taxation that they hope will safeguard their future revenues and offer stability to businesses that operate internationally. The main beneficiaries are likely to be rich countries, including the U.S.
In the opening session of their summit in Rome, leaders of the Group of 20 major economies gave their blessing to a global pact that has been more than a decade in the making, according to officials.
